snippet: The uprising was apparently led by allies of the country’s longtime ruler, Blaise Compaoré, who was ousted last year. Chérif Sy, the leader of parliament, declared himself interim president.
abstract: Military officers close to former Burkina-Faso president Blaise Compaore seize interim president Michel Kafando and Prime Min Isaac Zida, sparking violent protests; transitional government, in control since October 2014 revolution, has moved to marginalize allies of old regime; United Nations and France condemn coup, calling for release of hostages.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan and Hannah Olivennes contributed reporting from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The uprising was apparently led by allies of the country’s longtime ruler, Blaise Compaoré, who was ousted last year. Chérif Sy, the leader of parliament, declared himself interim president.

headline.main: Interim Leader Challenges Burkina Faso Military Coup
headline.print_headline: Leader of Parliament in Burkina Faso Challenges Coup
